autoop.core.ml.model.classification package

Submodules

autoop.core.ml.model.classification.multi_layer_perceptron module

class autoop.core.ml.model.classification.multi_layer_perceptron.MLP(num_layers: int = 3, num_epochs: int = 25, lr: float = 0.001, optimizer: Literal['adam', 'rmsprop', 'SGD'] = 'adam')[source]

Bases: Model, Module

Multi-layer perceptron model for classification.

Initialized automatically according to the attribute num_layers and the dimensions of observations and labels passed during fit.

num_layers

Number of layers in the model.

Type:

int

parameters

Dictionary storing model parameters.

Type:

dict[str, Any]

layers

Module list containing the layers of the model.

Type:

ModuleList

trainer

Contains the trainer object.

Type:

Trainer

type

Specifies the model type as ‘classification’.

Type:

Literal[“classification, “regression”]

fit(observations: ndarray, labels: ndarray) → None[source]

Fit the model to observations and labels.

Calls helper functions to convert observations and labels to tensors, set input and output dimensions based on the data, create model layers, instantiate the Trainer, and initiate the training loop.

Parameters:

  • observations (np.ndarray) – Array of training data.

  • labels (np.ndarray) – Array of target labels.

Raises:

  • AssertionError – If the number of samples in observations

  • and labels do not match. –

Returns:

None

forward(x: Tensor) → Tensor[source]

Perform a forward pass through all layers.

Applies ReLu activation function after each layer apart from the final layer.

Parameters:

x (Tensor) – Input tensor containing observations.

Returns:

Output tensor from the logistic regression layer.

Return type:

Tensor

property layers: ModuleList

Return a copy of the models layers if they have been created.

Raises:

AttributeError – If _layer have not been initialized yet.

Returns:

The models layers.

Return type:

ModuleList

property num_layers: int

Get the value of num_layers.

Returns:

The number of layers.

Return type:

int

property parameters: dict[str, Any]

Dynamically return the model parameters.

Returns the hyperparameters stored in the model as well as the fitted parameters from torch’s nn.Module.

Returns:

parameters dict including hyperparameters.

Return type:

dict[str, Any]

predict(observations: ndarray) → Tensor[source]

Predict class labels for the given observations.

Converts observations to tensors, performs a forward pass without gradient computation, and returns predicted class labels.

Parameters:

observations (np.ndarray) – Array of observations to predict.

Raises:

NotFittedError – If the model has not been fitted.

Returns:

Predicted class labels as a tensor.

Return type:

Tensor

property trainer: Trainer

Return a copy of the models trainer if it has been created.

Raises:

AttributeError – If the _trainer attribute does not exist.

Returns:

A copy of the trainer instance of the model.

Return type:

Trainer
